perturbation.original_text: 19. ARBITRATION: All disputes in connection with this Contract or the execution thereof shall be settled friendly through negotiations. In case no settlement can be reached, the case may then be submitted for arbitration to the Foreign Economic and Trade Arbitration Committee of the China Beijing Council for the Promotion of International Trade in accordance with its Provisional Rules of Procedures by the said Arbitration Committee. The Arbitration shall take place in Beijing and the decision of the Arbitration Committee shall be final and binding upon both parties; neither party shall seek recourse to a law court nor other authorities to appeal for revision of the decision. Arbitration fee shall be borne by the losing party.

perturbation.explanation: By placing the arbitration clause below the confidentiality clause, it becomes less prominent and could be overlooked. Arbitration clauses need to be conspicuous and easily identifiable to ensure enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China
perturbation.law_citation: Article 39 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China
perturbation.law_explanation: Article 39 stipulates that clauses excluding a party's main rights must be explicitly brought to the other party's attention. By burying the arbitration clause after the confidentiality clause, and shifting the numerical order, it is less likely to be considered to have been explicitly brought to the attention of the other party, especially if this contract will be applied to international sales contracts under the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. This makes it difficult to enforce.

perturbation.contradicted_law: United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG)
perturbation.law_explanation: Article 14 states that a proposal for concluding a contract addressed to one or more specific persons constitutes an offer if it is sufficiently definite and indicates the intention of the offeror to be bound in case of acceptance. Shifting the payment clause after the validity terms obscures key terms of the offer to be bound (price, payment terms), which can be deemed as not being sufficiently definite, potentially leading to legal disputes over contract enforceability. The payment terms are critical and should not be buried.

perturbation.original_text: 21. Law application It will be governed by the law of the People's Republic of China ,otherwise it is governed by United Nations Convention on Contract for the International Sale of Goods.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. General provisions

21. Law application It will be governed by the law of the People's Republic of China ,otherwise it is governed by United Nations Convention on Contract for the International Sale of Goods.
perturbation.explanation: By placing the law application in the General provisions, it can be overlooked by a party when reviewing the contract. The applicable law should be clear and conspicuous.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Civil Law of the People's Republic of China
perturbation.law_citation: Article 142 of the General Principles of Civil Law of the People's Republic of China
perturbation.law_explanation: Article 142 states that if an international treaty concluded or acceded to by the People's Republic of China contains provisions differing from those of the civil laws of the People's Republic of China, the provisions of the international treaty shall apply, unless those provisions have been excepted by the People's Republic of China. By shifting the law of application higher into the general provisions, it makes it less likely for parties to understand which law takes precedence. This is especially true if it is meant to fall under the jurisdiction of the CISG. The court will have to resolve which law applies.
